isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Diagnostic Tests - Injector Disable Tests

svcproc.title: Injector Disable Tests
svcproc.para: The Injector Disable Tests allow the technician to shut off injectors to determine if a specific cylinder is contributing to engine performance. An injector can be shut off one at a time, four alternative cylinders at a time, or four alternative cylinders plus one.
Alternate cylinders are every other cylinder in firing order.

When all cylinders are active, the contribution of each cylinder is 12.5% of its overall effect to maintain governed speed. When four cylinders are shut off, contribution of each remaining cylinder is 25% of its overall effect to maintain governed speed. The technician should monitor fuel rate, and engine load.
These tests detect problems with injection and combustion events. These tests should be done in conjunction with the crankcase pressure test and the Relative Compression Test (RCT).

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select V8 Injector Disable Test from the drop down menu.
From the V8 Injector Disable Test menu, select cylinder to disable and click Run.
To return to normal operation, select and click Normal Operation.
